column4: Kindred wins months-long pursuit of Gentiva with $1.8 billion deal
column5: Kindred Healthcare Inc  said on Thursday it would buy Gentiva Health Services Inc  in a cash and stock deal valued at $1.8 billion including debt  ending its months-long pursuit of the home-healthcare provider.

column4: UPDATE 2-Kindred wins months-long pursuit of Gentiva with $1.8 bln deal
column5: (Adds details  background  analyst comment  Kindred CEO comment)

column4: Kindred says to buy Gentiva in $1.8 bln deal
column5: Oct 9 Kindred Healthcare Inc said it would buy Gentiva Health Services Inc in a cash and stock deal valued at $1.8 billion  including the assumption of net debt.

column4: Exclusive: Share sale of UK's Lloyds on hold until dividend approved- sources
column5: LONDON Britain is unlikely to sell any more of its remaining 25 percent stake in Lloyds Banking Group  until the bailed-out lender is cleared to pay dividends again  banking and political sources told Reuters.

column4: EXCLUSIVE-Share sale of UK's Lloyds on hold until dividend approved -sources
column5: * Bank needs dividend go-ahead for sale to happen -sources

column4: M&T Bank to refund fees in deceptive accounts: U.S. agency
column5: WASHINGTON M&T Bank Corp will pay $2.9 million in refunds to some of its customers  the U.S. consumer watchdog announced on Thursday  saying that the bank had "deceptively" marketed free checking accounts but later charged fees for them.

column4: UPDATE 1-M&T Bank to refund fees in deceptive accounts -U.S. agency
column5: WASHINGTON  Oct 9 M&T Bank Corp will pay $2.9 million in refunds to some of its customers  the U.S. consumer watchdog announced on Thursday  saying that the bank had "deceptively" marketed free checking accounts but later charged fees for them.

column4: U.S. agency says M&T Bank to refund fees in deceptive bank accounts
column5: WASHINGTON  Oct 9 The U.S. consumer watchdog agency on Thursday said M&T Bank Corp would pay $2.9 million in refunds to customers after it deceptively marketed free checking accounts but later charged customers for its services.

column4: ON THE MOVE-RBC hires two brokers from Morgan Stanley in Pittsburgh
column5: NEW YORK  Oct 9 RBC Wealth Management said on Thursday it has hired two Morgan Stanley financial advisers at a suburban Pittsburgh brokerage office of the Royal Bank of Canada  unit.

column4: Morgan Stanley uses client cash to chase private equity profits
column5: Morgan Stanley is embracing the financial reforms intended to curb its animal spirits to generate bigger profits.

column4: INSIGHT-Morgan Stanley uses client cash to chase private equity profits
column5: Oct 9 Morgan Stanley is embracing the financial reforms intended to curb its animal spirits to generate bigger profits.

column4: EU Commission deregulates telecoms market for fixed line voice calls
column5: BRUSSELS European regulators can remove limits on the prices that leading telecoms firms such as Orange and Telecom Italia can charge smaller operators for accessing their telephone networks for voice calls  the European Commission said on Thursday.

column4: EU Commission deregulates telecoms market for fixed line voice calls
column5: * Retail  wholesale fixed line voice markets no longer regulated

column4: Pembina Pipeline to build C$350 mln diluent storage hub in Alberta
column5: CALGARY  Alberta  Oct 9 Canadian midstream company Pembina Pipeline Corp is set to build a C$350 million ($314 million) condensate and diluent terminal in central Alberta that will include 600 000 barrels of storage  the company said on Thursday.

column4: Rio Tinto says low iron ore price to eliminate 125 mln/T of supply
column5: SYDNEY  Oct 9 Rio Tinto  said falling iron ore prices would lead to the elimination of 125 million tonnes of iron ore supply among higher cost producers in 2014.

column4: Taiwan's TSMC says September sales up 35.1 pct on year
column5: TAIPEI  Oct 9 TSMC  the world's biggest contract chip maker  posted a 35.1 percent rise in September sales from a year earlier.    Following are details of the sales:                                 SEPT        Y/Y %   YR-TO-DATE   Y/Y %    Sales (T$ bln)      74.85       +35.1   540.29       +19.7        (US$ bln)     2.46          For a table on TSMC's website  see (http://link.reuters.com/zen56t)  (1 US dollar = 30.3670 Taiwan dollar)   (Reporting by Michael Gold)

column4: Allergan says third quarter and 2014 profit to beat expectations
column5: Botox maker Allergan Inc  said on Thursday it expects to report third-quarter profit that is more than 20 percent higher than it previously anticipated  which it said bolsters its contention that an unsolicited takeover offer by Valeant Pharmaceuticals Inc  undervalues the company.

column4: UPDATE 2-Allergan says 3rd qtr and 2014 profit to beat expectations
column5: Oct 9 Botox maker Allergan Inc said on Thursday it expects to report third-quarter profit that is more than 20 percent higher than it previously anticipated  which it said bolsters its contention that an unsolicited takeover offer by Valeant Pharmaceuticals Inc undervalues the company.

column4: CORRECTED-UPDATE 1-Allergan raises outlook; says Valeant offer undervalues company
column5: (Corrects paragraph 6 to say that 14-15 pct increase in product net sales is for the full year  not third quarter)

column4: Allergan raises outlook; says Valeant offer undervalues company
column5: Oct 9 Botox maker Allergan Inc lifted its third-quarter profit estimate and said the updated forecast showed that Valeant Pharmaceuticals Inc's takeover offer undervalued the company.
